Main Menu
Create Trip Button
Clicking this button will take you to the menu for creating a trip. A trip consist of a set of chosen locations which you want to visit.
Show My Locations Button
Click this button to go to a view presenting a list of all locations created by you.
Add Location
Map
Map is there for you to choose coordinates for your location - simply click on the map in a desired location, and a small marker will be displayed.

If all provided information is correct, a green toast will appear on top of the screen and you will be redirected to Main Menu.
Otherwise read toast will appear, providing information about what you need to fill in to successfuly create a location.
Trip Creator
Introduction
With using trip creator you are able to set and create new trip. In the creator it would be possible to set all important settings including adding locations to visit for each day of the trip.
MainSettings

On this page of the creator you can pick name for the trip and provide custom description. Moreover, here you must set start and end date of the trip. It is important since next page uses the information about number of days. You are also asked to choose TravelMode and DistanceUnit
Show Locations on Map

These views allow you to see location on the map, specifically in your closes area, but you can navigate the map to whichever place you want. Clicking a marker representing location on the map will show a small snippet above the location and also present location\'s name and status under the map.
Locations come in two types: public or private, and depending on which button you choose in Main Menu you\'ll either see all public locations or all private locations.
There are two buttons on the bottom of the view.
After selecting a location on map you can press this button and you\'ll be redirected to view that will present you details about your chosen location.
Clicking this button will redirect you to the Synchronization Panel, where you can download more locations.
Location\'s List
What you will see here is a list of all locations that have been download to your device. You can use the scroll to navigate the list.
If you want to see more information about a particular location, simply click it on the list. You will be redirected to location details view.
Location Details
Here you can see basic information about a chosen location, such as it\'s:
Settings

This view contains a list of all settings and preferences available in the application. Currently there are three: Language, Default User and Clear Databse. Select one of the settings by clicking it on the list
Language

Here you can choose language for Tour Trip application. At the moment you can choose only English and Polish, but more languages are to come! Select your language from the dropdown list and press button "Change language". Keep in mind that all location\'s and trip\'s descriptions will remain in the language they were originally wrtten in.
Default User

You can set your account to be a default account in the application, which will enable you to use "Log as default user" option when logging in. Simply check the checkbox and press "Change". Keep in mind one thing though: there can only be one default user, so any other user can override this setting.
Clear Database
If you ever think that there are many unused locations or trips on you device, here you can clear app\'s database.
By checking the boxes near "Private data" or "Public data" you can choose to delete only public, only private, or both types of locations from your device.

When it comes to trips, you can delete all trips from database, or only ones that are considered as \'past\', \'current\', or \'future\' - select from a dropdown menu the category. This will only remove trips that are connected to your account.
Show Trips

On this page you will see all your trips that have been downloaded in the app to your mobile device. You can filter your trips by their start and end dates, by clicking in top-right corner on the menu icon, and choosing your preferred filter:
• All Trips - default, show all trips belonging to you
• Past Trips - shows all trips, which have end date in the past (before current date)
• Current Trips - shows all trips which are \'active\' - current date is after their start date and before their end date (including)
• Future Trips - shows all trips, which have start date in the future (after current date)
If you want to see some details about the trip, click it on the list.
Trip Details

Here you can find all the information about the trip. On the first page you\'ll see it\'s name, duration (start date and end date) and description as well as list of days. Each day is represented by a date and clicking it will forward to the view presenting this trip day\'s details.
Trip Day Details

The most important thing about this view is the map - it shows all the locations that are part of this trip day. The map is centered and zoomed on the first location in the list. On the bottom there is a button Show Directions, which will take you to written so-called trip directions.
Trip Directions

Trip Directions are written hints, that will tell you where exactly you have to go to visit all the locations in your trip. A trip direction ins made of three things: instruction which tells you what you need to do (ex. Turn right onto Basztowa street), distance which you have to travel during that instruction (ex. 100 m) and estimated duration of that instruction.
Synchronize with server

Synchronizing local database with server\'s database is crucial for the application. This page allows you to download locations and trips, as well as send those created on your device. You can later access them either through web service or on another mobile device using out app.
Manage Locations
To download your private locations simply press the button Download Private Locations and wait for the operation to finish

To download locations in a given area press the button Download Locations In Scope. You will be redirected to another view with map. Use the map to set the point, that will be the center of area you\'re interested in. The default radius of the area equals 50 km, but you can set a smaller or bigger one - there is a field under the map just for this purpose. You can also change the distance unit from kilometers (default) to miles. After you set everything press Download Locations button and wait for the operations to finish.
To send locations simply check, which locations you want to send to server: Private, Public, or Both and press the button underneath!
Manage Trips

To either send or download trips simply check the corresponding bo under Mangage Trips header, and press the button underneath. It is possible to perform both actions at the same time, by checking bot hDownload and Send and pressing button Manage Trips.
Result of synchronization

If operation is successful the green toast will appear on the screen. However many things can go wrong when synchronizing with serve, for example because of bad internet connection. If any error will occur you will be informed in a red toast.
